page.title: 03LINCOLNSHIRE DELICACIES
page.content: STUFFED CHINE -THE CHINE IS BETWEEN THE TWO SHOULDERS OF THE PIG AND WEIGHS FROM 1O-14 LBS. TO STUFF IT WITH PARSLEY YOU ASK THE BUTCHER TO "NICK" IT ONE SIDE TO THE BONE AND TURN IT OVER AND "NICK" THE OTHER SIDE. YOU THEN WASH AND CHOP THE PARSLEY FINELY OR PUT IT THROUGH THE MINCER. YOU PROCEED TO STUFF THE MEAT EACH SIDE UNTIL YOU HAVE FILLED ALL THE "NICKS" WITH PARSLEY. THE STUFFED MEAT IS THEN WRAPPED IN A CLEAN WHITE CLOTH, TIED SECURELY AND PUT INTO BOILING WATER IN A COPPER. BRING BACK TO THE BOIL AND BOIL FOR HALF AN HOUR TO THE POUND PLUS HALF AN HOUR OVER. WHEN COLD CARVE THE OPPOSITE WAY TO THE "NICKS" AND EAT WITH VINEGAR AND MUSTARD AND A TOMATO. "DELICIOUS"
